title.native: 転生したらスライムだった件 第2期 第2クール
title.romaji: Tensei Shitara Slime Datta Ken 2nd Season Part 2
title.english: That Time I Got Reincarnated as a Slime Season 2 Part 2

description:
The second cour of Tensei Shitara Slime Datta Ken 2nd Season.

The nation of Tempest is in a festive mood after successfully overcoming the surprise attack from the Falmuth Army and the Western Holy Church. Beyond the festivities lies a meeting between Tempest and its allies to decide the future of the Nation of Monsters. The aftermath of the Falmuth invasion, Milim Nava's suspicious behavior, and the disappearance of Demon Lord Carrion—the problems seem to keep on piling up.

Rimuru Tempest, now awakened as a "True Demon Lord," decides to go on the offensive against Clayman. With the fully revived "Storm Dragon" Veldora, "Ultimate Skill" Raphael, and other powerful comrades, the ruler of the Tempest is confident in taking down his enemies one by one until he can face the man pulling the strings.
synonyms: 关于我转生变成史莱姆这档事第二季（下半）
เกิดใหม่ทั้งทีก็เป็นสไลม์ไปซะแล้ว ภาค 2 พาร์ท 2
Moi, quand je me réincarne en Slime Saison 2 Partie 2

tags.name: Kingdom Management
tags.description: Characters in these series take on the responsibility of running a town or kingdom, whether they take control of an existing one, or build their own from the ground up.

tags.name: Isekai
tags.description: Features characters being transported into an alternate world setting and having to adapt to their new surroundings.

tags.name: Reincarnation
tags.description: Features a character being born again after death, typically as another person or in another world.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Demons
tags.description: Prominently features malevolent otherworldly creatures.

tags.name: Politics
tags.description: Centers around politics, politicians, or government activities.

tags.name: War
tags.description: Partly or completely set during wartime.

tags.name: Shapeshifting
tags.description: Features character(s) who changes one's appearance or form.

tags.name: Dragons
tags.description: Prominently features mythical reptiles which generally have wings and can breathe fire.

tags.name: Afterlife
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the afterlife.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Goblin
tags.description: A goblin is a monstrous creature from European folklore. They are almost always small and grotesque, mischievous or outright malicious, and greedy. Sometimes with magical abilities.

tags.name: Female Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Monster Girl
tags.description: Prominently features a female character who is part-monster.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Clone
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is an artificial exact copy of another organism.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Femboy
tags.description: Features a boy who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of girls.

tags.name: Medieval
tags.description: Partially or completely set in the Middle Ages or a Middle Ages-inspired setting. Commonly features elements such as European castles and knights.

tags.name: Agender
tags.description: Prominently features agender characters.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Ninja
tags.description: Prominently features Japanese warriors traditionally trained in espionage, sabotage and assasination.

tags.name: Monster Boy
tags.description: Prominently features a male character who is a part-monster.

node.description:
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%B2%B8%E7%94%B0%E9%9A%86%E5%AE%8F)

Takahiro Kishida is an animator and renown character designer.

Kishida's designs are well received by animators and attract talent into shows easily. He is also praised for his shot composition skills and copies of his layouts are widely distributed in the industry as drawing reference. Nowadays he is mostly only credited for character design in the shows he participates in, but in reality he works as an animation director uncredited quite often. He rarely heavily corrects the key animator's cuts, strongly believing that the animators' distinctiveness should be noticeable.

Noted for his designs on shows like [Haikyuu](https://anilist.co/anime/20464/), [Serial Experiments Lain](https://anilist.co/anime/339/), [Madoka Magica](https://anilist.co/anime/9756/), [Baccano](https://anilist.co/anime/2251/) and more.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/明田川仁)

Affiliated with Magic Capsule, a recording studio led by his father [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062).

name.native: エレメンツ ガーデン

node.description:
__[Profile (Aria Entertainment)](https://www.ariamusic.co.jp/elements-garden/)__

A Japanese group of music composers, or a "music production brand" as they call themselves. They generally produce music for video games, anime and recording artists. They are attached to Aria Entertainment.

__Current Members:__ 
[Noriyasu Agematsu](https://anilist.co/staff/103633/Noriyasu-Agematsu) (Producer/Lyricist/Composer)
[Junpei Fujita](https://anilist.co/staff/110557/Junpei-Fujita) (Producer/Composer/Arranger)
[Hitoshi Fujima](https://anilist.co/staff/101273/Hitoshi-Fujima) (Composer/Arranger)
[Daisuke Kikuta](https://anilist.co/staff/147815/Daisuke-Kikuta) (Composer/Arranger)
[Seima Iwahashi](https://anilist.co/staff/146530/Seima-Iwahashi) (Composer/Arranger/Director)
[Ryutaro Fujinaga](https://anilist.co/staff/155960/Ryutaro-Fujinaga) (Lyricist/Composer)
[Ryota Tomaru](https://anilist.co/staff/140532/Ryota-Tomaru) (Composer/Arranger)
[Yuta Kasai](https://anilist.co/staff/259881/Yuuta-Kasai) (Composer/Arranger)
[Yusuke Takeda](https://anilist.co/staff/156645/Yusuke-Takeda) (Lyricist/Composer)
[Asuka Oda](https://anilist.co/staff/155968/Asuka-Oda) (Lyricist)
[Seima Kondou](https://anilist.co/staff/239286/Seima-Kondou) (Composer/Arranger)

__Former Members:__ 
Yasutomo Nakai (2005-2006)
[Masato Nakayama](https://anilist.co/staff/112097/Masato-Nakayama) (2007-2013)
[Evan Call](https://anilist.co/staff/119999/Evan-Call) (2012-2016)
Tomohiro Kita (2011-2016), Haruki Mori (2009-2018)
[Ryouta Suemasu](https://anilist.co/staff/155969/Ryouta-Suemasu) (2014-2019)

[Website (Hedworks)](http://hedworks.sakura.ne.jp/info.html) | [Twitter (Hedworks)](https://twitter.com/hed_works)

The president of Hedworks, a company that produces background art for anime and games.

_Note: Not to be confused with either of the two animators, [佐藤雅弘](https://anilist.co/staff/134126/) and [佐藤正博](https://anilist.co/staff/222513/)._

[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/MindaRynOfficial) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/mindaryn_) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/mindaryn_/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/MindaRyn/)

A Thai YouTuber known for singing anisong covers. She has gone on to perform the theme songs to several anime series.

__Height:__167 cm  
__Hobbies:__ Billiards, drawing, remaking clothes, singing  
__Skills & Abilities:__ Waking up early    

[Profile (Lantis)](https://www.lantis.jp/artist/terashimatakuma/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Terashima_dayo) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC2XXSJBvNygj81VPOJmCu-g)

His debut album "New Game" came out on June 6, 2012. Announced marriage with voice actress [Satomi Satou](https://anilist.co/staff/101560/Satomi-Satou) on July 6, 2017.

__[Profile (Verygoo)](http://www.verygoo.jp/artists/ron/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ron_sdf)__

__Ryuuta Iida__, also known by his stage name Ron (stylized as R・O・N) is a Japanese musician, arranger, composer, lyricist, sound producer, guitarist, keyboardist and singer. He was the sound producer and guitarist of Japanese rock band [OLDCODEX](https://anilist.co/staff/112151/OLDCODEX) along with seiyuu [Tatsuhisa Suzuki](https://anilist.co/staff/95735) from 2009-2012.

He currently works under the artist management company Verygoo, has a solo vocal project called [Stereo Dive Foundation](https://anilist.co/staff/118710/Stereo-Dive-Foundation), is a member of the rock band [ROSARYHILL](http://rosaryhill.net/) (2008-) as a keyboardist and vocalist, and works as a music creator for the creative music unit [(K)NoW_NAME](https://anilist.co/staff/126602/KNoW-NAME).

__[Profile (Verygoo)](http://www.verygoo.jp/artists/ron/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ron_sdf)__

__Ryuuta Iida__, also known by his stage name Ron (stylized as R・O・N) is a Japanese musician, arranger, composer, lyricist, sound producer, guitarist, keyboardist and singer. He was the sound producer and guitarist of Japanese rock band [OLDCODEX](https://anilist.co/staff/112151/OLDCODEX) along with seiyuu [Tatsuhisa Suzuki](https://anilist.co/staff/95735) from 2009-2012.

He currently works under the artist management company Verygoo, has a solo vocal project called [Stereo Dive Foundation](https://anilist.co/staff/118710/Stereo-Dive-Foundation), is a member of the rock band [ROSARYHILL](http://rosaryhill.net/) (2008-) as a keyboardist and vocalist, and works as a music creator for the creative music unit [(K)NoW_NAME](https://anilist.co/staff/126602/KNoW-NAME).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/sachiko_tonaki) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/sachiko.tonaki) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/who_is_sachiko/) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCNlHLg9hRSXr5wcsbh2Cm5Q)

Sachiko Tonaki plays guitar and handles the lead vocals for the rock band [FLiP](https://anilist.co/staff/111627/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/sachiko_tonaki) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/sachiko.tonaki) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/who_is_sachiko/) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCNlHLg9hRSXr5wcsbh2Cm5Q)

Sachiko Tonaki plays guitar and handles the lead vocals for the rock band [FLiP](https://anilist.co/staff/111627/).

Taiki Kawakami is a Japanese writer and artist.
